answerText: quaternions[10] This man showed that any three-dimensional rotation can be described by a set of three angles along perpendicular axes. He solved the Basel problem by showing that the sum of the inverses of the squares of natural numbers was pi squared over six.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Yale A | 9 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In this number system ij equals negative ji equals k. For 10 points each: [10] Name this number system devised by William Rowan Hamilton that can be used to represent rotations in a three dimensional space.
